content.description: Sit-start as for erosion and corrosion, strait up eliminate large holds to the left. Face moves until the huge ledge jug. Top out
content.location: Start in the dihedral with a crack then up the right face eliminating corners.

content.description: awkward sit start left side hold, right hand around the corner only your first finger fits in the hole. heel hook your right foot just below your right hand. left foot just below your right hand on the ledge. pull up left hand to sloper right hand up arete to side slope. left hand up to side hold (slightly krimpy). right hand to side hold (very good hold). left hand to krimper in front your face, dyno to top.
content.location: just below three cabins north side of campground. very good walk back down from the top.

content.description: The Katrina boulder is a small rock wall by the Campground boulder. It was named after the flood of 2010 when the water level was up against this boulder. The day it was found it had a bunch of dried water vegetation on it. With a little more scrubbing it could be a fun little area to warm up on.Â
